title: Structure of Probability Statements
text: The structure of a probability statement is P(xOC) where P stands for the probability, $$x$$ is the variable we are testing against, O is the operation (equal to, less than, less than or equal to, greater than, greater than or equal to) and C is the constant value.

title: Determining the variable
text: What is the variable that we are using?

title: Determining the operation
text: What is the operation? The inspector wants at most $$2$$ of the $$12$$ players to be defective. What operation best represents a ceiling when compared to a constant, or "at most", which is inclusive?

title: Determining the constant
text: What is the number of defective players we want at most in the sample?
